required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Antenatal and Postnatal Care Research Collective - Household Survey (ARCH)
clinical_study.official_title: Antenatal and Postnatal Care Research Collective - Household Survey (ARCH)

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to establish a longitudinal health, demographics, and pregnancy surveillance study in Lusaka, Zambia to precisely characterize the pregnancy rate, pregnancy outcomes, health and disease burden of women of reproductive age and their children under 2 years prior to, during, and following pregnancy and to investigate the structural, socio-demographic, and clinical covariates that contribute to adverse outcomes in each reproductive epoch.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a longitudinal household panel survey to describe the health of approximately 5,500 women of reproductive age (WRA) and their children < 2 years of age and investigate the structural, sociodemographic, and clinical risk factors and vulnerabilities that contribute to adverse outcomes. Households will be visited quarterly for up to 36 months. A head of household (defined as an adult > 18 years old residing in and knowledgeable about the household), each WRA in the household, and children <2 years will be surveyed quarterly for 24 months (a parent or next-of-kin will respond on behalf of the child). Women with prevalent or incident pregnancy and their infants will be followed for a minimum of 12 months from delivery. Approximately 2,000 children will be enrolled over the course of the study.

primary_outcome.description: total number of pregnancies including live births, stillbirths, and abortions per 1000 women aged 15-49
the proportion of pregnancies that result in a live birth at or beyond 37 gestational weeks
the number of deaths per 1,000 live births of children under one year of age

study_pop.textblock: Women of reproductive age and their children

criteria.textblock:
Head of Household eligibility criteria
Inclusion criteria:
- Adult greater than 18 years of age willing to provide written informed consent,
- willing to undergo household surveillance procedures
Exclusion criteria:
- Any other condition (social, environmental, or medical) that, in the opinion of the study staff, would make participation unsafe or complicate data interpretation. Study staff may note physical, psychological, or social conditions that are not explicitly stated in the eligibility criteria that could make some households poor candidates for study participation.
Women of reproductive age eligibility criteria
Inclusion criteria:
- 15-49 years of age
- Willing and able to provide written informed consent or assent with next-of-kin consent
- Willing to undergo surveillance procedures
Exclusion criteria:
- Any other condition (social or medical) that, in the opinion of the study staff, would make participation unsafe or complicate data interpretation. Study staff may note physical, psychological, or social conditions that are not explicitly stated in the eligibility criteria that could make some women poor candidates for study participation.
Children under 2:
There are no specific inclusion/exclusion. Anyone under 2 years of age living in the household is eligible. They do not need to be one of the children of the WRA

overall_official.affiliation: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

patient_data.ipd_description: Deidentified individual data that supports the results will be shared beginning 9 to 36 months following publication provided the investigator who proposes to use the data has approval from an Institutional Review Board (IRB), Independent Ethics Committee (IEC), or Research Ethics Board (REB), as applicable, and executes a data use/sharing agreement with UNC.
